page.title: 18THE CHURCH IN COCKFIELD 1985
page.content: Today we went to the church.It is called St. Peter's Church.When we got there, we asked the rector,Rev.J.Cook, some questions.He said that on some Sundays about 45 people go to church. The Sunday School starts at the same time as the morning service and the children come in half way through the service.The people who help in running the church are the two churchwardens, the organist,a verger and a layreader. The school and the church are closely linked because on Ascension Day and St. Peter's Day, the schoolchildren go to the church for a special service.On some Tuesday mornings,the rector will come and give lessons to the infant and junior classes.The other churches that the rector looks after are Felsham, Gedding and Bradfield St.George.In the Cockfield choir,there are 17 people and you can join when you are 8 years old.
